alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 5:55PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Talkeetna River. * WHEN...Until 500 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 552 PM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near Talkeetna River. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - For Talkeetna River at the Talkeetna Railroad Bridge: At 5:00pm the stage was 12.38 feet. Flood Stage is 13.0 feet. Impacts: At 10.0 feet: Water in low lying areas west of Main Street. Summer 2020 - Erosion at the confluence of the Talkeetna and Susitna Rivers. At 13.0 feet: High water during the summer floods of 2003; water flowed into the low lying areas near the end of the dike at the Talkeetna River. At 14.0 feet: Water can flow into Beaver Road and F Street in NE Talkeetna - For Talkeetna River Upstream of Talkeetna: At 4:45pm the stage was 10.27 feet. Flood Stage is 12.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 14.1 feet is expected Sunday morning. Impacts: At 10.0 feet: High water during the summer floods of 2003; water flowed into the low lying areas near the end of the dike at the mouth of the Talkeetna River. At 13.5 feet: Approximate 10% annual chance of flooding according to FEMA`s modeled Flood Insurance Study At 14.0 feet: Water can flow into Beaver Road and F Street in NE Talkeetna. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
